thread.title: UCF to play in first college hockey game at Amway Center
thread.title_full: UCF to play in first college hockey game at Amway Center

author: Staff reports
title: UCF to play in first college hockey game at Amway Center
text:
Sports Solar Bears UCF to play in first college hockey game at Amway Center Orlando Solar Bears players, from left, Scott Tanski, Eric Baier and Johnny McInnis model the team's uniforms for the 2015-16 ECHL season. Stephen M. Dowell/Orlando Sentinel 
Orlando Solar Bears players, from left, Scott Tanski, Eric Baier and Johnny McInnis model the team's uniforms for the 2015-16 ECHL season. 
Orlando Solar Bears players, from left, Scott Tanski, Eric Baier and Johnny McInnis model the team's uniforms for the 2015-16 ECHL season. (Stephen M. Dowell/Orlando Sentinel) Staff reports Amway Center to host college hockey game for first time 
UCF will take on South Carolina in the first college hockey game at Amway Center, the Orlando Solar Bears announced Thursday. 
The game is scheduled for Saturday night, Nov. 7, after the Solar Bears host the Florida Everblades at 7 that night. 
"This first college game is a jumping-off point for more big-time hockey to come,'' said John Bisignano, president and CEO of the Central Florida Sports Commission. 
UCF and South Carolina compete in Division III of the American Collegiate Hockey Association. The Knights have made nine consecutive appearances in the national tournament under coach Sean Weaver. 
Tickets purchased for the Solar Bears-Everblades game will be good for the UCF-South Carolina contest. 
The Solar Bears, who revealed their new uniforms for the 2015-16 season at a news conference Thursday at Amway Center, will play preseason games against the host Everblades at 7:30 Friday night and 7 Saturday night.
